article_metadata.description: The recent decision by the Supreme Court to ask the lower courts to review Little Sisters of the Poor v. Burwell, a case to determine if religious ministries and nonprofits must comply with the Obamacare contraception mandate, is a promising win for the Little Sisters’ homes in Ohio and across the country. Their attorneys called the Supreme Court’s decision a “game-changer,” and I couldn’t agree more.

og.title: Decision could  relieve Little Sisters
